alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:52AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY... COSHOCTON...NORTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTH CENTRAL TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM EDT... At 652 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Killbuck, or 12 miles southwest of Millersburg, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Coshocton, Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, West Lafayette, Warsaw, Conesville, Plainfield, Nellie, Norwich, Otsego, and Bridgeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 163 and 176. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 48 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
